  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found damaged on unload. Package was isolated and put into a hazardous bin. DescribePack: One of the bottles had a loose top and package was not sat to the side upright which caused package to leak. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a hazardous bin. Spill only damaged box and did not travel outside of box.

RESPONDER REFERED TO THE DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST AFTER THE RESPONSE AND DISPOSAL PROCESS WAS COMPLETED.

item.title: Report E-2023060113
item.description:
Report E-2023060113

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-17
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 17, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1263 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hepaco to remediate the impacted surfaces. Hepaco personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted interior and swept them in utilizing hand tools. The crew then containerized all UN1263 impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 85-gallon overpack for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023060229
item.description:
Report X-2023060229

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-25
  • City: MADISON
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHEN THE PACKAGE HANDLERS WERE UNLOADING THE BOX, THE BOX WAS ALREADY WET FROM THE CAP BEING LOOSE. THE PACKAGE HANDLERS PUT THE BOX ON THE ROLLERS AND I CLOSED THE LID AS SOON AS I SAW IT SO THE ITEM DID NOT LEAK ANY FURTHER. THERE WERE NO SPILLAGE ON THE FLOOR AS THE BOX SOAKED ALL THE LIQUID UP. DescribePack: THE CAP ON ONE OF THE MEDIVATORS RAPICIDE PA PART B WAS LOOSE WHICH CAUSED A LITTLE BIT OF THE DISINFECTENT TO SPILL. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I CLOSED THE LID AS SOON AS THE BOX WAS LOCATED

item.title: Report E-2023050674
item.description:
Report E-2023050674

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-30
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 30, 2023, at 1429 hours, FRA Hazmat inspector Kevin Cash reported GATX 37155, a loaded tank car of Creosote located in the CSX Montgomery Yard, was leaking from the manway. The car was isolated and the shipper, Blackwater Midstream, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2023-05-30-00318). Marion Environmental Inc. (MEI), a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found two of the six manway cover bolts were less than tool tight and the manway cover gasket was significantly worn. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative- Blake Chatagnier (504-414-2040, bchatagnier@bwcterminals.com). Contractor personnel replaced the manway cover gasket, properly secured all manway cover bolts, and wiped away residual product that was adhering to the outside of the car. Upon completion the car released for transport.
